definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: My administration has been setting out our environmental programme vigorously in the weeks since then.
sentences.chinese: 在随后的数周内，政府大力推展环保计划。

sentences.english: With a tourism industry being heavily promoted, Green Island once again began to show signs of life.
sentences.chinese: 在观光业的大力推展下，绿岛重新展现蓬勃的活力。

sentences.english: You see, technology is a way to evolve the evolution.
sentences.chinese: 看，科技是推展演化的方法。

sentences.english: The clubs promote korfball especially on the elementary schools.
sentences.chinese: 由俱乐部来推展合球特别是在小学里推展。

sentences.english: The clubs promote korfball especially on the elementary schools.
sentences.chinese: 由俱乐部来推展合球特别是在小学里推展。

sentences.english: We have one item that covers our work in its totality, and does so well into the future.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一个项目，涉及工作的全局，并推展到将来。

sentences.english: Arrange leisure activities properly to run the management of school with wholesome mind.
sentences.chinese: 妥适安排适度的休闲活动，以健康的身心推展校务。

sentences.english: The acknowledgment package to individual sponsor will be implemented immediately upon receiving commitment of sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 在接获个别赞助者的承诺后，鸣谢安排立即推展。

to shift resources into areas of need/to inject funds/to balance resources
